reviews.review:
I started playing as survivor because my Girlfriend really liked it and so I'd play with her. The amount of "good games" I've had can be counted on one hand. Survivors not only have to battle against extremely high odds, with every new killer being more broken than the next. From a doctor that corrupts your screen and punishes you for playing the game correctly, to a hillbilly that has a oneshot ability and is so fast that even if he doesn't one hit you, you can escape from him unless you run in circles like an idiot and frustrate the killer into leaving you alone. That being said, with the community as toxic as it is, if you overfrustrate the killer, he will catch you and stare at you on the hook until you die or punish your friends for trying to save you. 

All of that aside, I really found myself enjoying the killer portion of it. I LOVED playing as killer. Of course, they had to ruin that too with the ranking system. Being as I just started playing killer, my ranking isn't high. That being said, I guess I'm cursed to stay in low ranks because the matchmaking refuses to put surviors in my lobby. I'll wait for 15 minutes and never find anyone, close the lobby, reopen it, and wait another 15 minutes. 

10/10 great game. Wouldn't recommend if someone paid me.

Where to start, I started playing this when beta hit and boy did it have issies, more bugs than I care to think about and compared to now, few options between killers/survivors to pick from.

As of now, this DEV team has came a long way with this project. It's very enjoytable and they do a great job at trying to keep it balanced all though that can be difficult between all the perks and characters you can play. They do a great job on pumping content out (DLC) and they keep it reasonably priced. There are bugs from time to time but there kept to a minimul and they usually roll out a hotfix quickly to get them corrected.

I recommend this game if your looking for a fun horror themed environment and have the expectation that you will get "those" teammates from time to time and your gonna die. If you can accpet that then I think you will like what Dead by Daylight has to offer.

I got this game because my friends played it, and boy do I regret it.... The graphics are terrible, the game is riddled with bugs; both for the killers and the survivors (i.e. slow vaulting over pallets or crates when you are sprinting or fast vaulting which you will STILL be hit by killers despite being away from that area as far as possible.) Experienced Survivors will either teabag and waste a new killers time or a killer will tunnel on a single new survivor and make their life a living hell until they are dead on hook. Tunneling and camping are not bannable/reportable by a killer. But a survivor who "rage quits" or leaves a match because of it will be punished... the irony isn't lost.  As of 10/14/2018 survivors who dodge or leave a match no matter the reason will get a 1 week, then 2 week, 3 week and on their 4th leave a perma-ban. If I had known about this new ruleset I never would've bought this game in the first place and if I hadn't already clocked 48 hours on it asked for a full refund.

Updated Review: There are still bugs, but with the introduction of The Rift and unlockable cosmetics there is more of an incentive to grind out games and matches don't take forever to fill now that console crossplay is enabled. It's not as bad as it was before now that there are dedicated servers and killers can't depend on lag switching but they still need to update that code on those window seals... they're improving slowly but Killers still have to take meta perks like: Pop-BBQ-Undying-Ruin or else games end too fast once you reach single digit ranks.

I think that Dead by Daylight is a well crafted game,with a lot of work put into it.It is filled with many good and fun characters to play,and extreamly beautifull and magnificent maps.The events are a lot of fun and bring an awesome feeling of acomplishment  when you finish them,because you get awesome costumizations to show off to yourself or to your friends and strangers.I dont like the constant change in balance of the killers and survivors,and also,the strenghts of some killers are rather weak,and should be buffed to be played more frequently but,all in all its a well made game,and i recommend it!

He loved his job. Driving a train had been his dream ever since he was a child. He loved to make the train go as fast as possible. Unfortunately, one day he was a little too reckless and caused a crash. He made it out, but a single person died. Well, needless to say, he went to court over this incident. He was found guilty, and was sentenced to death by electrocution. When the day of the execution came, he requested a single banana as his last meal. After eating the banana, he was strapped into the electric chair. The switch was flown, sparks flew, and smoke filled the air - but nothing happened. The man was perfectly fine.


Well, at the time, there was an old Bulgarian law that said a failed execution was a sign of divine intervention, so the man was allowed to go free. Somehow, he managed to get his old job back driving the train. Having not learned his lesson at all, he went right back to driving the train with reckless abandon. Once again, he caused a train to crash, this time killing two people. The trial went much the same as the first, resulting in a sentence of execution. For his final meal, the man requested two bananas. After eating the bananas, he was strapped into the electric chair. The switch was thrown, sparks flew, smoke filled the room - and the man was once again unharmed.


Well, this of course meant that he was free to go. And once again, he somehow managed to get his old job back. To what should have been the surprise of no one, he crashed yet another train and killed three people. And so he once again found himself being sentenced to death. On the day of his execution, he requested his final meal: three bananas.


"You know what? No," said the executioner. "I've had it with you and your stupid bananas and walking out of here unharmed. I'm not giving you a thing to eat; we're strapping you in and doing this now." Well, it was against protocol, but the man was strapped in to the electric chair without a last meal. The switch was pulled, sparks flew, smoke filled the room - and the man was still unharmed. The executioner was speechless.


The man looked at the executioner and said, "Oh, the bananas had nothing to do with it. I'm just a bad conductor."

I am re-reviewing this game to examine the most intuitive parts and problems this game incurs. Firstly the game gives the players the choice to become killer or survivor. Over the past year or so I have seen various updates and additions that have changed how to survive and adapt to killers. Survivors have the upper hand when it comes to surviving the killer and its really easy to rank up (lower competition). There has been recent updates in dedicated servers, to try and offset how long it takes for the killer to get people in a match, still takes 10-20 min as killer to wait for players to join. Additions of recent killers is admirable to keep people interested. 

My previous review i had not recommended this game because of the glitches, and utter lack of developer attention to fans/players critiques. As well as there seems to be quite a bit of cheaters/hackers in the DbD servers. Constantly I see many things that should not happen in game. This could be to exploitation, but hacking is most common, especially when you see a survivor running around the map at 10x speed. 

On another note the graphics have changed in that there is more shadows/lighting, but at the cost to detail and foreground processing. DbD is somewhat Gpu taxing and thus even on one of the best graphics cards it still has its troubles, whereas in other games ultra setting with greater than 60 fps can be achieved. In game there is no option to change the graphic settings, just standard options which is a bad thing to have.

-Patches? killer sided (been a year since survivors were boosted)
-Bugs? killer sided (the list is endless)
-Bans? killer sided (they don't ban lag switchers, they mostly ban people who leave the game which most of the time are survivors who face lag switchers)
-Hacks? very easy to hack, people even live stream hacks and they don't get banned
Great game regular updates just the community tends to be Toxic half of the time in OCE you dont see much cheaters or toxic people but you still get your fair share of them.

TL;DR: Do not buy this game for anything more than $5. 
Edit - 10/23/18: After playing the most recent update, I feel that I need to revise my previous statement. Don't buy this game for any price over $1.99. 

Edit - 02/26/19: Roughly 70% of the attempts to play this game come with pretty ridiculous performance issues. Tons of lag, glitches all over the place, and consistently having to end the process in task manager. This game really went downhill.

This review is written in October 2018 after playing for roughly 6 months. This game was fun at one point. But, the developers continue to change the game in a way that promotes increasingly toxic behavior and gameplay. From what I can tell, very little is being done to hedge against this. In addition to the community going downhill, every new update brings new and exciting game-breaking bugs. I really do hope this game improves soon. I had a blast when i first started playing it.

Let me get clear right of the bat: this game is not bad, on the contrary, it's a good game.
Why do I don't recommend this game ? For many reason.
This game is a asymetric game were you play either as a survivor who is trying to flee from a killer that try to murder you but putting you on meat hook.
The gameplay is intense as well as the survivor, who have to repair motors, with sometimes QTE, and get scared when the killer jumpscare you by coming from an angle you didn't see.
As the killer, you have to be quick to find the survivor not prevent them escaping.
You get in the end blood point to make your character (Either Killer or survivor) more powerfull
The game is intense, fun and spooky sometimes.
Now the problem:
Despite being a game you pay, it uses the same scheme as the free to play.
First you have 3 money:
-The blood points you can get from just playing, and will be more and more depending on you score. Fair enough.
-The Iridescent Shards that you get by leveling your player level, they are REALLY LONG to get (Currently level 7 and I have less than 691) and allow you to eventually buy a killer (Which cost around 9000 Shard) But NOT ALL KILLER can be bought throught shard. Same for survivors.
-Auric Cell which are the money you can only buy using money.
Problem is that you pay for a game, that have half of the killer available only through DLC, and uses the same system of pay to win.
The thing is that, Killers you can obtain throught DLC are (or at least feel) really hard to deal with, making the surviving experience really tough and even more if you didn't bought the survivor DLC too.
Obviously, there are also cosmetics you can buy... but same as before, pull out your (rare) iridescent shard or break your piggybank. Plus each DLC Killer cost around 7â‚¬, the base game cost 20â‚¬ so for a total of approximately 73â‚¬ you have a game that is only multiplayer, with just a few maps (that are at least free).
And let's not talk about the community that is... really horrible (Camping killer, survivor that mess you up so you get caught etc etc)
Or if you want to play as a Killer ? Good luck finding survivors, the connexion can be horrible...
Is this game fun ? Yes
Is it good to play with friend ? It's awesome !
Does this game worth the price ? Without the DLC I would say yes, but not at all with the DLC.
Do I recommend it ? Only if you're ready to pay a lot, overall no.
This game just try to milk you out of your money, give your money to some other game that don't do that.
I think we did a pretty good job soo far
